Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= man; ► prophet; time of kings David (דָּוִד) and Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= woman, also known as Bath Shua (בַּת־שׁוּעַ) ◄ daughter of Eliam (אֱלִיעָם) (also known as Ammiel (עַמִּיאֵל) wife of Uriah (אוּרִיָּה) and later of David (דָּוִד)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= causative action by which deities decide to no longer hold a certain human's behavior against that person, as if by erasing that sin from one's record
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
literally: to wash; hence: = causative by which deities remove guilt from humans after they have sinned
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
literally: to cleanse; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be free of moral contamination
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which someone is considered as upright and innocent in character and behavior
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= process by which humans and animals bring forth new offspring
= state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= process by which humans become pregnant
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
meaning unsure; possibly: = that which is hidden from view and/or an interior part of the body ≈ in the deepest part of one's being; hidden thoughts, attitudes
literally, to shut or close; hence = action by which a fact or some knowledge is shut or hidden from awareness
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= causative action by which a human being performs the ritual of removing the state of guilt or uncleanness from another person or object

= plant with a shrub like base and stems which are erect, stiff and strong; it reaches a height of just under one meter; it may grow from the ground but also spring out of crevices in walls, cliffs and rocks; its leaves and branches are hairy, and its flowers white; ◄ origanum maru; ► the plant is aromatic, and the dried leaves are used as a condiments; the leaves and little branches, when collected in bunches, are suitable for sprinkling purposes, as the hairy surface holds the liquid; used in the ritual purification of the Jews
literally: to be clean; hence: = state in which humans are free of moral contamination and acceptable to God
literally: to wash; hence: = causative by which deities remove guilt from humans after they have sinned

= frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: (one's) bones, extended to denote the entire person; hence: = a reference to one's self
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to suffer harm and humiliation, ◄ which feels as if having been crushed with a heavy object

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= causative action by which deities decide to no longer hold a certain human's behavior against that person, as if by erasing that sin from one's record
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans or deities are free from moral contamination
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to be established; hence: = state in which someone's heart (לֵב) or spirit (רוּחַ) is committed to following the will of God
= causative action by which humans or deities bring an event back to its original condition

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to take place that has happened before
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions
= causative process by which deities provide mental strength to humans
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= pattern of actions by which humans commit specified or implied offenses, ► resulting in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: to open (someone's) lips; hence: = causative action by which deities enable humans to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to crush|to make humble|to make contrite
Node.definition: literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to become humble and remorseful ◄ by causing that person to suffer harm and humiliation

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is morally and/or ethically right

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= an object that is wholly burned ► as a gift or sacrifice to God
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
literally: to make go up; hence: = causative process by which humans offer a burnt offering and cause its smoke to go up
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such
